div.l: Þat was made of youre oune mele
Wheche I helpe my Fader to stele
And gode lēmman god the saue and kepe
And with that worde sche be gan to wepe
Aleyn̄ vpriste and þought er that dawe
I will go crepe in be my fellowe
And fonde the Cradill with his honde anone
By god qduod he alle wrongꝭe I haue misgone
My hede is toty of my swynke to night
Þat makith me that I go not aright
I wote well be the Cradell I haue mys go
Here lieth the Miller and his wife alsoo
And forthe he gothe in twenty deuill wey
To the bedde there as the Miller lay
He wente haue crepte in be his fellowe Iohn
And by the Miller he crepte yn anone
And caught him be the necke and softe he spak
And saide thou swynes hede awake
For cristis soule and here a noble game
For by þat lorde þat callid is Seint Iame
As I haue thries in this shorte nyght
Swyued the Millers dought̉er bolte vp right
Whiles þu haste as a couerte ben̄ a gaste
Ye fals harlot qduod þe Miller in haste
A fals traitour fals clerke qduod he
Þu schalt be dede be goddis dignite
Who durste be so bolde to disꝑparage
My doughter þat is comen of suche lynage
And be the throte bolle he caught aleyn̄
And he hente him dispitously ayen
And on the nose he smote him with his fiste
Doun̄ ranne the blode streme on his breste
And in the flore with nose and mouthe I broke
Thei walewid as pigges done in a poke
And vp thei gone and doun̄ ayen anone
Till that the Miller spourned atte a stone
And doıı̄un he felle ⁊and bakward on his wife
That wist no thing of this nyce strife
For she was fallen in slepe a litill wight
With Iohn the Clerke that waked all night
And wᵗith þat falle oute of hire slepe she breied
Helpe holy crosse of Brome holme she saide
In manus tuas lorde qduod she to the y call
A wake Simkyn̄ the fende is on vs fall
Myn herte is broken̄ helpe I am but dede
